headline.main: Fresh Fighting In Philippines; Death Toll Rises to 100

lead_paragraph: Fresh fighting broke out on Jolo island today, and the death toll in an uprising by guerrillas loyal to a rebellious Muslim governor rose to more than 100, military officials said. The officials said they had used helicopter gunships and World War II vintage bomber planes to attack guerrilla positions. They also said they had sought the help of Malaysia to keep the governor, Nur Misuari, from escaping there by sea. The navy threatened to sink any boat he tried to use.
abstract: New fighting breaks out on Philipping island of Jolo as death toll in Muslim guerrilla rebellion rises to 100; photo; military says attacks are meant to prevent election for successor to governor Nur Misuari, who led revolt for Islamic state; authorities seek Malaysia's help to prevent Misuari from escaping to there by sea (M)
